column4: Can someone help me fix my nvidia drivers. I had a radeon 7000 installed and I pulled it out to put in a geforce 5500 fx card. I installed the drivers hardware told me to 173. I think. The only 2 resolutions I have is 640x480 and some 320 one. Im new to linux and didn't know how to uninstall radeon drivers. Thx
nvidia settings is what giving me the 2 resolutions only.. Display won't let me use it and suggest nvidia settings.
did you read the last msg to u?
yea i just saw it hold on
you want to remove ati's proprietary drivers?
wait you said you used a Radeon 7000, so you couldn't have been using the proprietary drivers
I had 7000 installed when I installed ubuntu.. So I dunno if it installs it on its own.. I can show u my xorg.conf in paste bin if that helps..
heres my xorg.conf and my lspci http://pastebin.com/m6032aa4b and http://pastebin.com/m320a496a
I know ur a busy person it seems, but let me know if u have the time to check out the pastebin.. this resolution thing is way too big. and annoying
should I just try to download the nvidia driver straight from their site instead of using the hardware driver ubuntu recommends such as 173?
you can try, but you must uninstall the ubuntu-provided one first

Well after installing 173 recommended drivers from hardware, I couldn't get past a resolution of 640x480. I tried installing 173 straight from nvidia and it installed fine, after I rebooted my monitor said Out of Range. I then tried to proceed to fix graphics card to enable default drivers. All I got was blank screen. So here I am fresh format :(
